description.p: Yuan-ti were originally humans who transformed themselves into serpent folk through ancient rituals. Most yuan-ti were corrupted into monsters by those rites, but some yuan-ti instead became a new people who mix characteristics of humans and snakes.
All nagas share the following traits.
Ability Score Increase. Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Alignment. Most naga are either neutral or neutral evil in alignment.

Size. Yuan-Ti with serpentine lower halves typically stand about 5 feet tall when upright, but the total length of their bodies, head to tail, ranges from 10 to as much as 20 feet. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Natural Weapons. Your fanged maw and constricting serpentine body are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with your bite, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, and your target must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 poison damage. If you hit with your constrict attack, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, and you can attempt to grapple the target.
Binding Coils.Creatures you grapple are restrained,

Speed Burst. By lowering your body to the ground and propelling yourself with your arms, you can move more quickly for a time. As a bonus action on your turn, if you have both hands free, you can Dash.
Poison Immunity. You are immune to poison damage and can’t be poisoned.
Poison Affinity. You gain proficiency with the poisoner’s kit.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

description.p: To the people at large, ratfolk find the most difficulty with life in Korrik. They are deft of foot and are sometimes drawn to a criminal lifestyle. Though this is true of some ratfolk, they are no more violent or larcenous than others, but old stereotypes linger, especially with them. Called the nenajaa, or “we who live” in Rat Speech, many fail to understand the tough lives ratfolk lead are not entirely of their making.

Ratfolks are a rodent-like humanoids. They are shorter than humans, and appear almost frail. They have heads shaped like rats, with an elongated skull, thin lips, a rat's snout, and monocoloured beads for eyes. The fur that grows on their bodies is usually thin, and commonly comes in a range from light browns to dark gray and black. Despite their origins in the Feywild, they are not themselves fey.

Due to their association with rats, they are generally avoided by the aristocracies of human settlements, but can find places amongst the elves and dwarves for example. They are usually a nocturnal folk but, contrary to popular beliefs, are not sensitive to light.

Although not a people with great history, only having made a presence after the Era of Upheavals, there are a decent number of ratfolk communities. They tend to stay with each other in great families, both for cultural reasons, and the societal one that they have poor reputations. Many ratfolk families end up in the protective of Cormyr, but just as many work with the seedy underbellies of cities such as Westgate and Neverwinter.
The ratfolk character is a race that focuses on several traits, holding these to be common ground among the vast majority of their race.
Quick and silent, ratfolk exist as outsiders no matter where they are, but they let nothing get in their way.
Ability Score Increase. Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.
Creature Type. You are a Humanoid.
Size. Ratfolk look thin and frail, standing about 5'3” and 5'6”, and weighing around 110–120 lbs. Your size is Medium.
Speed. Your base walking speed is 35 feet. Ratfolk are quick on their feet.
Alignment. Ratfolk are strongly inclined to follow their own path, preferring freedom over all else, which makes them strongly chaotic. Ratfolk are rarely evil, but most are morally neutral.

Age. Ratfolk commonly live a due to quick reproduction and harsh environment and social practices little over 50 years, maintaining good vitality and longevity toward the end. Ratfolk reach adulthood at age 15, with the fur on their bodies turning grey once they've lived about 30 years.

Darkvision. You are used to dark areas, and your eyes have adjusted to such. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.
Sneaky. You have proficiency in the Stealth skill.
Thin Frame. You can squeeze through spaces as if you were one size smaller.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan.
Subrace. Ratfolk are a varied lot, and tend to adapt to their environment. Choose a subrace from between urban and wild.
You can squeeze through spaces as if you were one size smaller, and you have advantage on the Tumble action against creatures larger than yourself.

description.p: Ratfolk are separated into two subraces, colloquially described as sneaks and n, which come with different benefits. Choose one of these subraces.
Ratfolk communities in cities tend to become notorious for their role as thieves and informants. Leveraging their cunning and speed to avoid danger as it comes.
Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 1.
Duplicity. You have proficiency in the Deception skill.
Skulker. While you are in darkness or dim lighting, you have advantage on stealth checks to remain hidden.

description.p: Wild ratfolk live in nature, keeping to their feywild origins. They are not averse to society - as many do end up assisting and joining druidic covens, but may find prejudice due to the reputation of their other kind regardless. They may also take up nomadic lives of traders and scavengers.
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
Keen Senses. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Sure-Footed. When you take the Dash action, and on your first turn of combat encounters, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage and natural difficult terrain doesn't require extra movement.
